article:
'Husky' () is a general name for a type of dog used to pull sleds in northern
regions, differentiated from other sledge dog types by their fast pulling
style. Dogs of the Iditarod, by Jeff Schultz, pg 41, Sasquatch
Books, January 28, 2003, ISBN 1-57061-292-7 They are "an ever-changing cross-
breed of the...fastest dogs". Dogs of the Iditarod, by Jeff Schultz,
Sasquatch Books, January 28, 2003, ISBN 1-57061-292-7 The Alaskan
Malamute, by contrast, is "the largest and most powerful" sled
dog, http://www.norsled.org/info.htm and was used for heavier loads.
Huskies are used in sled dog racing. In recent years companies have been
marketing tourist treks with dog sledges for adventure travelers in snow regions
as well. http://adventure.howstuffworks.com/outdoor-activities/snow-
sports/sled-dog.htm Huskies are also today kept as pets, and groups work
to find new pet homes for retired racing and adventure trekking dogs. http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-
bin/article.cgi?f=/g/a/2011/02/18/petscol021811.DTL
